name: market for sodium oxide | sodium oxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17657/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'sodium oxide', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;'sodium oxide'  is an inorganic substance with a CAS no. : 001313-59-3. It is called 'disodium;oxygen(2-)' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: Na2O. It is solid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure , it appears as a white solid, which reacts violently with water to form sodium hydroxide. It is modelled as a pure substance. On a consumer level, is used in the following products: metals and welding & soldering products. There is no publicly available information about the consumption of this substance on industrial sites.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'sodium oxide',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'sodium oxide',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
